intro: Sageraea listeri var. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
